VALUER Type: VALUERSDescription: Highways and Transport

decision_conditions: The applicant has failed to provide sufficient information / evidence to demonstrate that the proposed development would meet the required floor to ceiling height across the proposed accommodation in line with internal space standards, set out in the London Plan 2021, as such, Officers are not able to conclude that the development would provide a good standard of internal accommodation for future residents. As such, the proposal would be contrary to Policy DM10 of the RBK Core Strategy 2012 and Policy D6 of the London Plan 2021.
The proposed development is provided with inadequate cycle storage to serve the new development, contrary to Policy T5 of the London Plan, 2021.

The proposals would provide for inadequate means of refuse/recycling storage for future occupiers, contrary to Policy D3 of the London Plan, 2021, Policy CS9 of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012 and Policy Guidance 22 of the Council's Residential Design SPD, 2013.

In the absence of a signed legal agreement to prevent occupiers or visitors to the proposed unit from obtaining a residents parking or visitors parking permit to mitigate any parking pressures, the proposed development would not comply with Paragraph 107 of the NPPF 2021, Policy T6 of the London Plan 2021 and Policy DM10 of the Council's Core Strategy 2012.
The proposed accommodation would be provided with undersized built-in storage when assessed against minimum standards set out in Policy D6 of the London Plan, 2021.
description: Change of use of Ground Floor from Use Class E (retail) to Use Class C3 (residential)
